docs.title: ComfyKit
docs.text:
ComfyUI - UI + Kit = ComfyKit

Python SDK for ComfyUI - Support Local or Cloud - Generate images, videos, audio in 3 lines

📖 Documentation | 🚀 Quick Start | 🎯 DSL Reference | 💡 Examples | ❓ Issues

docs.title: ✨ What is ComfyKit?
docs.text: ComfyKit is a pure Python SDK that provides a clean API for executing ComfyUI workflows and returns structured Python objects.

docs.title: Execute a workflow in 3 lines of code
docs.text:
from comfykit import ComfyKit

# Connect to local ComfyUI server
kit = ComfyKit(comfyui_url="http://127.0.0.1:8188")
result = await kit.execute("workflow.json", {"prompt": "a cute cat"})

print(result.images)  # ['http://127.0.0.1:8188/view?filename=cat_001.png']

# 🌐 Or use RunningHub cloud (no local GPU needed)
# kit = ComfyKit(runninghub_api_key="rh-xxx")

docs.title: Get structured data back
docs.text:
# ExecuteResult object, not strings!
result.status          # "completed"
result.images          # All generated image URLs
result.images_by_var   # Images grouped by variable name
result.videos          # Video URLs (if any)
result.audios          # Audio URLs (if any)
result.duration        # Execution time

docs.title: 🎯 Key Features
docs.text:
• ⚡ Zero Configuration: Works out of the box, connects to local ComfyUI by default (http://127.0.0.1:8188)
  • ☁️ Cloud Execution: Seamless RunningHub cloud support - No GPU or local ComfyUI needed
  • 🎨 Simple API: 3 lines of code to execute workflows, no need to understand internals
  • 📊 Structured Output: Returns ExecuteResult objects, not strings
  • 🔄 Smart Detection: Auto-detects local files, URLs, and RunningHub workflow IDs
  • 🔌 Lightweight: Less than 10 core dependencies
  • 🎭 Multimodal Support: Images, videos, audio - all in one place

docs.title: 🔍 ComfyKit vs ComfyUI Native API
docs.text: Aspect ComfyUI Native API ComfyKit Complexity Manual WebSocket/HTTP handling 3 lines of code Return Value Raw JSON, need to parse yourself Structured ExecuteResult object Media Handling Need to construct URLs manually Automatically generates complete media URLs Error Handling Need to implement yourself Built-in comprehensive error handling Best For Familiar with ComfyUI internals Just want quick integration

docs.title: API Reference
docs.text: Complete API reference for ComfyKit.

docs.title: Constructor
docs.text:
class ComfyKit:
    def __init__(
        self,
        # Local ComfyUI configuration
        comfyui_url: Optional[str] = None,
        executor_type: Literal["http", "websocket"] = "http",
        api_key: Optional[str] = None,
        cookies: Optional[str] = None,

        # RunningHub cloud configuration
        runninghub_url: Optional[str] = None,
        runninghub_api_key: Optional[str] = None,
        runninghub_timeout: int = 300,
        runninghub_retry_count: int = 3,
    )

docs.title: execute Method
docs.text:
async def execute(
    self,
    workflow: Union[str, Path],
    params: Optional[Dict[str, Any]] = None,
) -> ExecuteResult

Parameters: - workflow: Workflow source (file path, URL, or RunningHub ID) - params: Workflow parameters

Returns: - ExecuteResult: Structured execution result

docs.title: execute_json Method
docs.text:
async def execute_json(
    self,
    workflow_json: Dict[str, Any],
    params: Optional[Dict[str, Any]] = None,
) -> ExecuteResult

Parameters: - workflow_json: Workflow JSON dictionary - params: Workflow parameters

Returns: - ExecuteResult: Structured execution result

docs.title: ExecuteResult Class
docs.text:
class ExecuteResult:
    status: str                           # "completed" or "failed"
    prompt_id: Optional[str]              # Prompt ID
    duration: Optional[float]             # Duration in seconds

    # Media outputs
    images: List[str]                     # All image URLs
    videos: List[str]                     # All video URLs
    audios: List[str]                     # All audio URLs
    texts: List[str]                      # All text outputs

    # Grouped by variable name
    images_by_var: Dict[str, List[str]]   # Images by variable
    videos_by_var: Dict[str, List[str]]   # Videos by variable
    audios_by_var: Dict[str, List[str]]   # Audios by variable
    texts_by_var: Dict[str, List[str]]    # Texts by variable

    # Raw outputs
    outputs: Optional[Dict[str, Any]]     # Raw output data
    msg: Optional[str]                    # Error message (if failed)

docs.title: Usage Example
docs.text:
import asyncio
from comfykit import ComfyKit

async def main():
    # Initialize
    kit = ComfyKit()

    # Execute workflow
    result = await kit.execute("workflow.json", {
        "prompt": "a cute cat"
    })

    # Access results
    print(f"Status: {result.status}")
    print(f"Images: {result.images}")
    print(f"Duration: {result.duration}s")

asyncio.run(main())

docs.title: Configuration
docs.text: ComfyKit configuration guide.

docs.title: Configuration Priority
docs.text:
ComfyKit uses the following priority for configuration:

  1. Constructor parameters (highest priority)
  2. Environment variables
  3. Default values

docs.title: Local ComfyUI Configuration
docs.text:
kit = ComfyKit(
    # ComfyUI server URL
    comfyui_url="http://127.0.0.1:8188",  # Default

    # Execution mode: http (recommended) or websocket
    executor_type="http",  # Default

    # API Key (if ComfyUI requires authentication)
    api_key="your-api-key",

    # Cookies (if needed)
    cookies="session=abc123"
)

docs.title: RunningHub Cloud Configuration
docs.text:
kit = ComfyKit(
    # RunningHub API URL
    runninghub_url="https://www.runninghub.ai",  # Default

    # RunningHub API Key (required)
    runninghub_api_key="rh-key-xxx",

    # Timeout (seconds)
    runninghub_timeout=300,  # Default: 5 minutes

    # Retry count
    runninghub_retry_count=3,  # Default: 3 retries

    # Instance type (optional)
    runninghub_instance_type="plus"  # Use 48GB VRAM machine
)

docs.title: Environment Variables
docs.text:
# ComfyUI configuration
export COMFYUI_BASE_URL="http://127.0.0.1:8188"
export COMFYUI_EXECUTOR_TYPE="http"
export COMFYUI_API_KEY="your-api-key"
export COMFYUI_COOKIES="session=abc123"

# RunningHub configuration
export RUNNINGHUB_BASE_URL="https://www.runninghub.ai"
export RUNNINGHUB_API_KEY="rh-key-xxx"
export RUNNINGHUB_TIMEOUT="300"
export RUNNINGHUB_RETRY_COUNT="3"
export RUNNINGHUB_INSTANCE_TYPE="plus"  # Optional, use 48GB VRAM machine

docs.title: Quick Start
docs.text: This guide will help you get started with ComfyKit in minutes.

docs.title: Option 1: RunningHub Cloud (No GPU needed) ⭐
docs.text:
If you don't have a local GPU or ComfyUI environment, use RunningHub cloud:

import asyncio
from comfykit import ComfyKit

async def main():
    # Initialize with RunningHub (only API key needed)
    kit = ComfyKit(
        runninghub_api_key="your-runninghub-key"
    )

    # Execute with workflow ID
    result = await kit.execute("12345", {
        "prompt": "a beautiful sunset over the ocean"
    })

    print(f"🖼️  Generated images: {result.images}")

asyncio.run(main())

Get Your API Key

Get your free API key at RunningHub

docs.title: Option 2: Local ComfyUI
docs.text: If you have ComfyUI running locally:

docs.title: 1. Start ComfyUI
docs.text:
# Start ComfyUI (default port 8188)
python main.py

docs.title: 2. Execute workflow
docs.text:
import asyncio
from comfykit import ComfyKit

async def main():
    # Connect to local ComfyUI (default: http://127.0.0.1:8188)
    kit = ComfyKit(comfyui_url="http://127.0.0.1:8188")

    # Execute workflow
    result = await kit.execute(
        "workflow.json",
        params={"prompt": "a cute cat playing with yarn"}
    )

    # Check results
    if result.status == "completed":
        print(f"✅ Success! Duration: {result.duration:.2f}s")
        print(f"🖼️  Images: {result.images}")
    else:
        print(f"❌ Failed: {result.msg}")

asyncio.run(main())

💡 Tip: comfyui_url defaults to http://127.0.0.1:8188 and can be omitted

docs.title: Understanding the Results
docs.text:
When you execute a workflow, ComfyKit returns an ExecuteResult object:

result = await kit.execute("workflow.json", {"prompt": "a cat"})

# Basic information
print(result.status)          # "completed" or "failed"
print(result.duration)        # Execution time in seconds
print(result.prompt_id)       # Unique execution ID

# Generated media
print(result.images)          # List of image URLs
print(result.videos)          # List of video URLs
print(result.audios)          # List of audio URLs

# Grouped by variable name
print(result.images_by_var)   # Dict of images grouped by output variable

docs.title: DSL Best Practices
docs.text: Guidelines for using ComfyKit's Workflow DSL effectively.

docs.title: Parameter Naming
docs.text:
✅ Good: Use descriptive names 

"_meta": {"title": "$positive_prompt.text!"}

❌ Bad: Use single letters 

"_meta": {"title": "$p.text!"}

docs.title: Required Markers
docs.text:
Use ! for parameters with no reasonable default:

✅ Good: Prompt is required 

"_meta": {"title": "$prompt.text!"}

❌ Bad: Seed probably has a good default 

"_meta": {"title": "$seed!"}

docs.title: Upload Markers
docs.text:
Always use ~ for image/video/audio parameters:

✅ Good: 

"_meta": {"title": "$~input_image"}

docs.title: Output Variables
docs.text:
Use $output.xxx for important outputs:

✅ Good: Named outputs are easy to reference 

"_meta": {"title": "$output.final_image"}

docs.title: Display Text
docs.text:
Add descriptive text for clarity:

✅ Good: 

"_meta": {"title": "Canvas Size, $width!, $height!"}

❌ Bad: 

"_meta": {"title": "$width!, $height!"}

docs.title: Complete Example
docs.text:
{
  "5": {
    "class_type": "EmptyLatentImage",
    "_meta": {
      "title": "Canvas, $width!, $height!"
    }
  },
  "6": {
    "class_type": "CLIPTextEncode",
    "_meta": {
      "title": "$positive_prompt.text!"
    }
  },
  "10": {
    "class_type": "LoadImage",
    "_meta": {
      "title": "$~init_image"
    }
  },
  "9": {
    "class_type": "SaveImage",
    "_meta": {
      "title": "$output.final"
    }
  }
}

docs.title: DSL Outputs
docs.text: Mark workflow outputs with the $output.name marker to easily reference generated media.

docs.title: Basic Output Marking
docs.text:
{
  "9": {
    "class_type": "SaveImage",
    "_meta": {
      "title": "$output.cover"
    },
    "inputs": {
      "filename_prefix": "book_cover",
      "images": ["8", 0]
    }
  }
}

Access by name: 

result = await kit.execute("workflow.json", params)
cover_image = result.images_by_var["cover"][0]

docs.title: Multiple Outputs
docs.text:
{
  "9": {
    "class_type": "SaveImage",
    "_meta": {
      "title": "$output.cover"
    }
  },
  "15": {
    "class_type": "SaveImage",
    "_meta": {
      "title": "$output.thumbnail"
    }
  }
}

Access each: 

cover = result.images_by_var["cover"][0]
thumbnail = result.images_by_var["thumbnail"][0]

docs.title: Auto-detection
docs.text:
Without $output markers, ComfyKit auto-detects outputs by node ID:

# Access by node ID
images_from_node_9 = result.images_by_var["9"]

docs.title: Workflow DSL Overview
docs.text:
ComfyKit provides a concise DSL (Domain Specific Language) for marking workflow nodes, allowing you to:

  • Define dynamic parameters
  • Mark output variables
  • Specify required/optional parameters
  • Automatically handle media file uploads

docs.title: DSL Syntax Quick Reference
docs.text:
These DSL markers are written in the title field of ComfyUI workflow nodes to convert fixed workflows into parameterizable templates.

Usage Steps: 1. In ComfyUI editor, double-click a node and modify its title to add DSL markers (e.g., $prompt.text!) 2. Save as API format JSON (select "Save (API Format)" from menu, not regular "Save") 3. Execute with parameters via kit.execute("workflow.json", {"prompt": "value"})

⚠️ Important: ComfyKit requires API format workflow JSON, not UI format.

Syntax Description Example Effect $param Basic parameter (shorthand) $prompt Parameter prompt, maps to field prompt $param.field Specify field mapping $prompt.text Parameter prompt, maps to field text $param! Required parameter $prompt! Parameter prompt is required, no default $~param Media parameter (upload) $~image Parameter image requires file upload $~param! Required media parameter $~image! Parameter image is required and needs upload $param.~field! Combined markers $img.~image! Parameter img maps to image, required and upload $output.name Output variable marker $output.cover Mark output variable name as cover Text, $p1, $p2 Multiple parameters Size, $width!, $height! Define multiple parameters in one node

docs.title: How It Works
docs.text:
The DSL works by adding markers to the _meta.title field of workflow nodes:

{
  "6": {
    "class_type": "CLIPTextEncode",
    "_meta": {
      "title": "$prompt.text!"
    },
    "inputs": {
      "text": "a beautiful landscape",
      "clip": ["4", 1]
    }
  }
}

When you execute this workflow:

result = await kit.execute("workflow.json", {
    "prompt": "a cute cat"
})

ComfyKit automatically: 1. Parses the DSL markers 2. Replaces the text field with "a cute cat" 3. Executes the modified workflow

docs.title: Parameter Markers
docs.text:
• $param - Basic parameter
  • $param.field - Parameter with field mapping
  • $param! - Required parameter
  • $~param - Media upload parameter

See Parameters for detailed examples.

docs.title: Output Markers
docs.text:
• $output.name - Mark output variables

See Outputs for detailed examples.

docs.title: Next Steps
docs.text:
• Learn about Parameters in detail
  • Understand Outputs marking
  • Read Best Practices

docs.title: DSL Parameters
docs.text: Detailed guide on parameter markers in ComfyKit's Workflow DSL.

docs.title: Basic Parameter
docs.text:
The simplest form - parameter name matches the field name:

{
  "3": {
    "class_type": "KSampler",
    "_meta": {
      "title": "$seed"
    },
    "inputs": {
      "seed": 0
    }
  }
}

Usage: 

result = await kit.execute("workflow.json", {"seed": 42})

docs.title: Field Mapping
docs.text:
Map a parameter to a different field name:

{
  "6": {
    "class_type": "CLIPTextEncode",
    "_meta": {
      "title": "$prompt.text"
    },
    "inputs": {
      "text": "default prompt"
    }
  }
}

Usage: 

result = await kit.execute("workflow.json", {"prompt": "a cat"})
# "prompt" parameter maps to "text" field

docs.title: Required Parameters
docs.text:
Mark parameters as required with !:

{
  "5": {
    "class_type": "EmptyLatentImage",
    "_meta": {
      "title": "$width!, $height!"
    },
    "inputs": {
      "width": 512,
      "height": 512
    }
  }
}

Usage: 

# Must provide both width and height
result = await kit.execute("workflow.json", {
    "width": 1024,
    "height": 768
})

docs.title: Media Upload Parameters
docs.text:
Mark parameters that need file upload with ~:

{
  "10": {
    "class_type": "LoadImage",
    "_meta": {
      "title": "$~input_image"
    },
    "inputs": {
      "image": "default.png"
    }
  }
}

Usage: 

result = await kit.execute("workflow.json", {
    "input_image": "/path/to/image.jpg"  # Auto-uploads
})

docs.title: Combined Markers
docs.text:
Combine field mapping, upload, and required markers:

{
  "10": {
    "class_type": "LoadImage",
    "_meta": {
      "title": "$img.~image!"
    },
    "inputs": {
      "image": "default.png"
    }
  }
}

This means: - Parameter name: img - Maps to field: image - Requires upload: ~ - Is required: !

docs.title: Multiple Parameters
docs.text:
Define multiple parameters in one node:

{
  "5": {
    "class_type": "EmptyLatentImage",
    "_meta": {
      "title": "Canvas Size, $width!, $height!, $batch_size"
    },
    "inputs": {
      "width": 512,
      "height": 512,
      "batch_size": 1
    }
  }
}

Text without $ is ignored (display text only).

docs.title: Optional (with default)
docs.text:
"_meta": {
  "title": "$seed"
}
  • If not provided, uses default from workflow
  • No error if omitted

docs.title: Required (no default)
docs.text:
"_meta": {
  "title": "$seed!"
}
  • Must be provided
  • Errors if omitted

docs.title: Complete Example
docs.text:
{
  "4": {
    "class_type": "CheckpointLoaderSimple",
    "_meta": {
      "title": "$model.ckpt_name"
    },
    "inputs": {
      "ckpt_name": "sd_xl_base_1.0.safetensors"
    }
  },
  "5": {
    "class_type": "EmptyLatentImage",
    "_meta": {
      "title": "Size, $width!, $height!"
    },
    "inputs": {
      "width": 1024,
      "height": 1024
    }
  },
  "6": {
    "class_type": "CLIPTextEncode",
    "_meta": {
      "title": "$prompt.text!"
    },
    "inputs": {
      "text": "a beautiful landscape"
    }
  },
  "10": {
    "class_type": "LoadImage",
    "_meta": {
      "title": "$~init_image"
    },
    "inputs": {
      "image": "default.png"
    }
  }
}

Usage: 

result = await kit.execute("workflow.json", {
    "prompt": "a cute cat",           # Required
    "width": 1024,                     # Required
    "height": 768,                     # Required
    "model": "dreamshaper_8.safetensors",  # Optional
    "init_image": "/path/to/init.jpg"  # Optional, auto-uploads
})

docs.title: Execute Local Workflow
docs.text:
The most basic usage is to execute a local workflow file:

from comfykit import ComfyKit

# Connect to local ComfyUI (default: http://127.0.0.1:8188)
kit = ComfyKit()

# Execute local workflow file
result = await kit.execute("workflow.json", {
    "prompt": "a cat",
    "seed": 42,
    "steps": 20
})

docs.title: Execute Remote Workflow URL
docs.text:
ComfyKit can automatically download and execute workflows from URLs:

# Automatically download and execute
result = await kit.execute(
    "https://example.com/workflow.json",
    {"prompt": "a cat"}
)

docs.title: Execute Workflow from Dict
docs.text:
You can also pass a workflow as a Python dictionary:

workflow_dict = {
    "nodes": [...],
    "edges": [...]
}

result = await kit.execute_json(workflow_dict, {
    "prompt": "a cat"
})

docs.title: Custom ComfyUI Server
docs.text:
Connect to a remote ComfyUI server:

kit = ComfyKit(
    comfyui_url="http://my-server:8188",
    api_key="your-api-key"  # If authentication is required
)

docs.title: Parameters
docs.text:
Workflows can accept parameters that are defined in the workflow DSL. See Workflow DSL for more details.

result = await kit.execute("workflow.json", {
    "prompt": "a beautiful landscape",
    "width": 1024,
    "height": 768,
    "seed": 42,
    "steps": 30
})

docs.title: Error Handling
docs.text:
Always check the execution status:

result = await kit.execute("workflow.json", params)

if result.status == "completed":
    print("Success!")
    print(f"Images: {result.images}")
else:
    print(f"Failed: {result.msg}")

docs.title: Async/Await
docs.text:
ComfyKit uses async/await for all operations:

import asyncio
from comfykit import ComfyKit

async def main():
    kit = ComfyKit()
    result = await kit.execute("workflow.json", {"prompt": "a cat"})
    print(result.images)

# Run the async function
asyncio.run(main())

docs.title: RunningHub Cloud Execution
docs.text: Use RunningHub cloud platform to execute workflows without local GPU or ComfyUI installation.

docs.title: Get API Key
docs.text:
1. Visit RunningHub
  2. Sign up for a free account
  3. Get your API key from the dashboard

docs.title: Basic Usage
docs.text:
from comfykit import ComfyKit

# Initialize with RunningHub API key
kit = ComfyKit(
    runninghub_api_key="rh-key-xxx"
)

# Execute with workflow ID
result = await kit.execute("12345", {
    "prompt": "a beautiful landscape"
})

docs.title: Configuration
docs.text:
kit = ComfyKit(
    # RunningHub API URL (optional)
    runninghub_url="https://www.runninghub.ai",  # Default

    # API Key (required)
    runninghub_api_key="rh-key-xxx",

    # Timeout in seconds (optional)
    runninghub_timeout=300,  # Default: 5 minutes

    # Retry count (optional)
    runninghub_retry_count=3  # Default: 3 retries
)

docs.title: Environment Variables
docs.text:
export RUNNINGHUB_BASE_URL="https://www.runninghub.ai"
export RUNNINGHUB_API_KEY="rh-key-xxx"
export RUNNINGHUB_TIMEOUT="300"
export RUNNINGHUB_RETRY_COUNT="3"

docs.title: Complete Example
docs.text:
import asyncio
from comfykit import ComfyKit

async def main():
    # Initialize with RunningHub
    kit = ComfyKit(
        runninghub_api_key="rh-key-xxx"
    )

    # Execute workflow
    result = await kit.execute("12345", {
        "prompt": "a cute cat playing with yarn",
        "width": 1024,
        "height": 768,
        "steps": 30
    })

    if result.status == "completed":
        print(f"✅ Success! Duration: {result.duration:.2f}s")
        print(f"🖼️  Images: {result.images}")
    else:
        print(f"❌ Failed: {result.msg}")

asyncio.run(main())

  • RunningHub workflow gallery

  • Shared workflow links

docs.title: Local ComfyUI
docs.text: This guide covers how to use ComfyKit with a local ComfyUI installation.

docs.title: Prerequisites
docs.text:
1. Have ComfyUI installed locally
  2. Start ComfyUI server (default port 8188)

docs.title: Starting ComfyUI
docs.text:
cd /path/to/ComfyUI
python main.py

By default, ComfyUI runs on http://127.0.0.1:8188.

docs.title: Basic Configuration
docs.text:
ComfyKit automatically connects to local ComfyUI by default:

from comfykit import ComfyKit

# Uses default URL http://127.0.0.1:8188
kit = ComfyKit()

docs.title: Custom Configuration
docs.text:
If your ComfyUI runs on a different port or host:

kit = ComfyKit(
    comfyui_url="http://localhost:8189"
)

docs.title: Executor Types
docs.text: ComfyKit supports two executor types:

docs.title: HTTP Executor (Recommended)
docs.text:
kit = ComfyKit(
    executor_type="http"  # Default
)

Advantages: - More stable - Better error handling - Recommended for production

docs.title: WebSocket Executor
docs.text:
kit = ComfyKit(
    executor_type="websocket"
)

Advantages: - Real-time progress updates - Lower latency for long-running workflows

docs.title: Authentication
docs.text:
If your ComfyUI server requires authentication:

kit = ComfyKit(
    comfyui_url="http://my-server:8188",
    api_key="your-api-key",
    cookies="session=abc123"
)

docs.title: Environment Variables
docs.text:
You can also configure via environment variables:

export COMFYUI_BASE_URL="http://127.0.0.1:8188"
export COMFYUI_EXECUTOR_TYPE="http"
export COMFYUI_API_KEY="your-api-key"
export COMFYUI_COOKIES="session=abc123"

Then initialize without parameters:

kit = ComfyKit()  # Uses environment variables

docs.title: Complete Example
docs.text:
import asyncio
from comfykit import ComfyKit

async def main():
    # Connect to local ComfyUI
    kit = ComfyKit(
        comfyui_url="http://127.0.0.1:8188",
        executor_type="http"
    )

    # Execute workflow
    result = await kit.execute(
        "workflow.json",
        params={
            "prompt": "a cute cat playing with yarn",
            "width": 1024,
            "height": 768
        }
    )

    # Check results
    if result.status == "completed":
        print(f"✅ Success! Duration: {result.duration:.2f}s")
        print(f"🖼️  Images: {result.images}")

        # Download images if needed
        for img_url in result.images:
            print(f"Image URL: {img_url}")
    else:
        print(f"❌ Failed: {result.msg}")

asyncio.run(main())

docs.title: Connection Refused
docs.text:
If you get a connection refused error:

  1. Make sure ComfyUI is running
  2. Check the port number (default is 8188)
  3. Verify the URL is correct

docs.title: Timeout Errors
docs.text:
For long-running workflows, you may need to increase timeout:

import httpx

kit = ComfyKit(
    comfyui_url="http://127.0.0.1:8188",
)
# Note: Timeout configuration coming soon

docs.title: Result Processing
docs.text: Understanding and processing execution results from ComfyKit.

docs.title: ExecuteResult Object
docs.text:
When you execute a workflow, ComfyKit returns an ExecuteResult object:

result = await kit.execute("workflow.json", {"prompt": "a cat"})

docs.title: Status
docs.text:
# Check execution status
if result.status == "completed":
    print("Success!")
elif result.status == "failed":
    print(f"Failed: {result.msg}")

docs.title: Duration
docs.text:
# Execution time in seconds
print(f"Execution took {result.duration:.2f} seconds")

docs.title: Prompt ID
docs.text:
# Unique execution identifier
print(f"Execution ID: {result.prompt_id}")

docs.title: All Media Files
docs.text:
# List of all image URLs
print(result.images)  # ['http://...', 'http://...']

# List of all video URLs
print(result.videos)  # ['http://...']

# List of all audio URLs
print(result.audios)  # ['http://...']

# List of all text outputs
print(result.texts)  # ['generated text...']

docs.title: Grouped by Variable
docs.text:
If your workflow uses $output.name markers, you can access outputs by variable name:

# Get specific output by name
cover_image = result.images_by_var["cover"][0]
thumbnail = result.images_by_var["thumbnail"][0]

# Get video by name
final_video = result.videos_by_var["final"][0]

docs.title: Download Images
docs.text:
import httpx
from pathlib import Path

async def download_image(url: str, save_path: Path):
    async with httpx.AsyncClient() as client:
        response = await client.get(url)
        save_path.write_bytes(response.content)

# Download all images
for i, img_url in enumerate(result.images):
    await download_image(img_url, Path(f"output_{i}.png"))

docs.title: Display in Jupyter
docs.text:
from IPython.display import Image, display

# Display first image
display(Image(url=result.images[0]))

# Display all images
for img_url in result.images:
    display(Image(url=img_url))

docs.title: Use with PIL
docs.text:
from PIL import Image
import httpx
from io import BytesIO

async def load_pil_image(url: str) -> Image.Image:
    async with httpx.AsyncClient() as client:
        response = await client.get(url)
        return Image.open(BytesIO(response.content))

# Load and process
pil_image = await load_pil_image(result.images[0])
pil_image.show()

# Further processing
resized = pil_image.resize((512, 512))
resized.save("output.png")

docs.title: Raw Outputs
docs.text:
Access the raw output data:

# Full raw output dictionary
print(result.outputs)

docs.title: Complete Example
docs.text:
import asyncio
from comfykit import ComfyKit
from pathlib import Path
import httpx

async def main():
    kit = ComfyKit()

    # Execute workflow
    result = await kit.execute("workflow.json", {
        "prompt": "a beautiful sunset"
    })

    # Check status
    if result.status != "completed":
        print(f"Failed: {result.msg}")
        return

    print(f"✅ Success! Took {result.duration:.2f}s")
    print(f"Generated {len(result.images)} images")

    # Access by variable name
    if "cover" in result.images_by_var:
        cover_url = result.images_by_var["cover"][0]
        print(f"Cover image: {cover_url}")

    # Download all images
    output_dir = Path("outputs")
    output_dir.mkdir(exist_ok=True)

    async with httpx.AsyncClient() as client:
        for i, img_url in enumerate(result.images):
            response = await client.get(img_url)
            output_path = output_dir / f"image_{i}.png"
            output_path.write_bytes(response.content)
            print(f"Saved: {output_path}")

asyncio.run(main())

docs.title: ComfyKit
docs.text:
ComfyUI - UI + Kit = ComfyKit

面向开发者的 ComfyUI Python SDK，支持本地或云端，3 行代码生成图像、视频、音频

📖 在线文档 | 🚀 快速开始 | 🎯 DSL 标记 | 💡 示例代码 | ❓ 问题反馈

docs.title: ✨ ComfyKit 是什么？
docs.text: ComfyKit 是一个纯粹的 Python SDK，提供简洁的 API 来执行 ComfyUI workflows，返回结构化的 Python 对象。

docs.title: 3 行代码执行一个 workflow
docs.text:
from comfykit import ComfyKit

# Connect to local ComfyUI server
kit = ComfyKit(comfyui_url="http://127.0.0.1:8188")
result = await kit.execute("workflow.json", {"prompt": "a cute cat"})

print(result.images)  # ['http://127.0.0.1:8188/view?filename=cat_001.png']

# 🌐 Or use RunningHub cloud (no local GPU needed)
# kit = ComfyKit(runninghub_api_key="rh-xxx")

docs.title: 获得结构化的返回数据
docs.text:
# ExecuteResult 对象，不是字符串！
result.status          # "completed"
result.images          # 所有生成的图片 URL
result.images_by_var   # 按变量名分组的图片
result.videos          # 视频 URL（如果有）
result.audios          # 音频 URL（如果有）
result.duration        # 执行耗时

docs.title: 🎯 核心特性
docs.text:
• ⚡ 零配置开箱即用：默认连接本地 ComfyUI (http://127.0.0.1:8188)
  • ☁️ 云端执行支持：无缝对接 RunningHub 云平台 - 无需 GPU 或本地 ComfyUI
  • 🎨 极简 API：3 行代码执行 workflow，无需理解内部实现
  • 📊 结构化输出：返回 ExecuteResult 对象，而非字符串
  • 🔄 智能识别：自动识别本地文件、URL 或 RunningHub workflow ID
  • 🔌 轻量级：核心依赖少于 10 个
  • 🎭 多模态支持：图像、视频、音频一站式支持

docs.title: 🔍 ComfyKit vs ComfyUI 原生 API
docs.text: 方面 ComfyUI 原生 API ComfyKit 复杂度 需要手动处理 WebSocket/HTTP 3 行代码搞定 返回值 原始 JSON，需要自己解析 结构化 ExecuteResult 对象 媒体处理 需要手动构造 URL 自动生成完整的媒体 URL 错误处理 需要自己实现 内置完善的错误处理 适合人群 熟悉 ComfyUI 内部机制 只想快速集成

docs.title: API 参考
docs.text: ComfyKit 完整 API 参考。

docs.title: 构造函数
docs.text:
class ComfyKit:
    def __init__(
        self,
        # 本地 ComfyUI 配置
        comfyui_url: Optional[str] = None,
        executor_type: Literal["http", "websocket"] = "http",
        api_key: Optional[str] = None,
        cookies: Optional[str] = None,

        # RunningHub 云端配置
        runninghub_url: Optional[str] = None,
        runninghub_api_key: Optional[str] = None,
        runninghub_timeout: int = 300,
        runninghub_retry_count: int = 3,
    )

docs.title: execute 方法
docs.text:
async def execute(
    self,
    workflow: Union[str, Path],
    params: Optional[Dict[str, Any]] = None,
) -> ExecuteResult

参数： - workflow: Workflow 源（文件路径、URL 或 RunningHub ID） - params: Workflow 参数

返回： - ExecuteResult: 结构化执行结果

docs.title: execute_json 方法
docs.text:
async def execute_json(
    self,
    workflow_json: Dict[str, Any],
    params: Optional[Dict[str, Any]] = None,
) -> ExecuteResult

参数： - workflow_json: Workflow JSON 字典 - params: Workflow 参数

返回： - ExecuteResult: 结构化执行结果

docs.title: ExecuteResult 类
docs.text:
class ExecuteResult:
    status: str                           # "completed" 或 "failed"
    prompt_id: Optional[str]              # Prompt ID
    duration: Optional[float]             # 执行时间（秒）

    # 媒体输出
    images: List[str]                     # 所有图片 URL
    videos: List[str]                     # 所有视频 URL
    audios: List[str]                     # 所有音频 URL
    texts: List[str]                      # 所有文本输出

    # 按变量名分组
    images_by_var: Dict[str, List[str]]   # 按变量分组的图片
    videos_by_var: Dict[str, List[str]]   # 按变量分组的视频
    audios_by_var: Dict[str, List[str]]   # 按变量分组的音频
    texts_by_var: Dict[str, List[str]]    # 按变量分组的文本

    # 原始输出
    outputs: Optional[Dict[str, Any]]     # 原始输出数据
    msg: Optional[str]                    # 错误消息（如果失败）

docs.title: 使用示例
docs.text:
import asyncio
from comfykit import ComfyKit

async def main():
    # 初始化
    kit = ComfyKit()

    # 执行 workflow
    result = await kit.execute("workflow.json", {
        "prompt": "a cute cat"
    })

    # 访问结果
    print(f"状态: {result.status}")
    print(f"图片: {result.images}")
    print(f"耗时: {result.duration}秒")

asyncio.run(main())

docs.title: 配置优先级
docs.text:
ComfyKit 使用以下配置优先级：

  1. 构造函数参数（最高优先级）

  3. 默认值

docs.title: 本地 ComfyUI 配置
docs.text:
kit = ComfyKit(
    # ComfyUI 服务器 URL
    comfyui_url="http://127.0.0.1:8188",  # 默认值

    # 执行模式：http（推荐）或 websocket
    executor_type="http",  # 默认值

    # API Key（如果 ComfyUI 需要认证）
    api_key="your-api-key",

    # Cookies（如果需要）
    cookies="session=abc123"
)

docs.title: RunningHub 云端配置
docs.text:
kit = ComfyKit(
    # RunningHub API URL
    runninghub_url="https://www.runninghub.ai",  # 默认值

    # RunningHub API Key（必需）
    runninghub_api_key="rh-key-xxx",

    # 超时（秒）
    runninghub_timeout=300,  # 默认：5 分钟

    # 重试次数
    runninghub_retry_count=3,  # 默认：3 次重试

)

docs.title: 快速开始
docs.text: 本指南将帮助你在几分钟内开始使用 ComfyKit。

docs.title: 方案一：RunningHub 云端（无需 GPU）⭐
docs.text:
如果你没有本地 GPU 或 ComfyUI 环境，使用 RunningHub 云平台：

import asyncio
from comfykit import ComfyKit

async def main():
    # 使用 RunningHub 初始化（只需 API key）
    kit = ComfyKit(
        runninghub_api_key="your-runninghub-key"
    )

    # 使用 workflow ID 执行
    result = await kit.execute("12345", {
        "prompt": "a beautiful sunset over the ocean"
    })

    print(f"🖼️  生成的图片: {result.images}")

asyncio.run(main())

获取 API Key

在 RunningHub 免费获取 API key

docs.title: 方案二：本地 ComfyUI
docs.text: 如果你有本地运行的 ComfyUI：

docs.title: 1. 启动 ComfyUI
docs.text:
# 启动 ComfyUI（默认端口 8188）
python main.py

docs.title: 2. 执行 workflow
docs.text:
import asyncio
from comfykit import ComfyKit

async def main():
    # Connect to local ComfyUI (default: http://127.0.0.1:8188)
    kit = ComfyKit(comfyui_url="http://127.0.0.1:8188")

    # 执行 workflow
    result = await kit.execute(
        "workflow.json",
        params={"prompt": "a cute cat playing with yarn"}
    )

    # 检查结果
    if result.status == "completed":
        print(f"✅ 成功！耗时: {result.duration:.2f}秒")
        print(f"🖼️  图片: {result.images}")
    else:
        print(f"❌ 失败: {result.msg}")

asyncio.run(main())

💡 提示：comfyui_url 默认为 http://127.0.0.1:8188，可省略此参数

docs.title: 理解返回结果
docs.text:
当你执行一个 workflow 时，ComfyKit 会返回一个 ExecuteResult 对象：

result = await kit.execute("workflow.json", {"prompt": "a cat"})

# 基本信息
print(result.status)          # "completed" 或 "failed"
print(result.duration)        # 执行耗时（秒）
print(result.prompt_id)       # 唯一执行 ID

# 生成的媒体文件
print(result.images)          # 图片 URL 列表
print(result.videos)          # 视频 URL 列表
print(result.audios)          # 音频 URL 列表

# 按变量名分组
print(result.images_by_var)   # 按输出变量分组的图片字典

docs.title: 下一步
docs.text:
• 了解配置选项
  • 探索使用示例
  • 理解 Workflow DSL 来参数化你的 workflow
  • 查看完整示例代码

docs.title: DSL 最佳实践
docs.text: 有效使用 ComfyKit Workflow DSL 的指南。

docs.title: 参数命名
docs.text:
✅ 好: 使用描述性名称 

"_meta": {"title": "$positive_prompt.text!"}

❌ 不好: 使用单字母 

"_meta": {"title": "$p.text!"}

docs.title: 必需标记
docs.text:
对没有合理默认值的参数使用 !：

✅ 好: Prompt 是必需的 

"_meta": {"title": "$prompt.text!"}

❌ 不好: Seed 通常有好的默认值 

"_meta": {"title": "$seed!"}

docs.title: 上传标记
docs.text:
总是对图片/视频/音频参数使用 ~：

✅ 好: 

"_meta": {"title": "$~input_image"}

docs.title: 输出变量
docs.text:
对重要输出使用 $output.xxx：

✅ 好: 命名的输出易于引用 

"_meta": {"title": "$output.final_image"}

docs.title: 显示文本
docs.text:
添加描述性文本以提高清晰度：

✅ 好: 

"_meta": {"title": "Canvas Size, $width!, $height!"}

❌ 不好: 

"_meta": {"title": "$width!, $height!"}

docs.title: 完整示例
docs.text:
{
  "5": {
    "class_type": "EmptyLatentImage",
    "_meta": {
      "title": "Canvas, $width!, $height!"
    }
  },
  "6": {
    "class_type": "CLIPTextEncode",
    "_meta": {
      "title": "$positive_prompt.text!"
    }
  },
  "10": {
    "class_type": "LoadImage",
    "_meta": {
      "title": "$~init_image"
    }
  },
  "9": {
    "class_type": "SaveImage",
    "_meta": {
      "title": "$output.final"
    }
  }
}

docs.title: DSL 输出
docs.text: 使用 $output.name 标记来标记 workflow 输出，以便轻松引用生成的媒体。

docs.title: 基础输出标记
docs.text:
{
  "9": {
    "class_type": "SaveImage",
    "_meta": {
      "title": "$output.cover"
    },
    "inputs": {
      "filename_prefix": "book_cover",
      "images": ["8", 0]
    }
  }
}

按名称访问： 

result = await kit.execute("workflow.json", params)
cover_image = result.images_by_var["cover"][0]

docs.title: 多个输出
docs.text:
{
  "9": {
    "class_type": "SaveImage",
    "_meta": {
      "title": "$output.cover"
    }
  },
  "15": {
    "class_type": "SaveImage",
    "_meta": {
      "title": "$output.thumbnail"
    }
  }
}

分别访问： 

cover = result.images_by_var["cover"][0]
thumbnail = result.images_by_var["thumbnail"][0]

docs.title: 自动检测
docs.text:
没有 $output 标记时，ComfyKit 通过节点 ID 自动检测输出：

# 通过节点 ID 访问
images_from_node_9 = result.images_by_var["9"]

docs.title: 下一步
docs.text: • 阅读最佳实践

docs.title: Workflow DSL 概览
docs.text:
ComfyKit 提供了简洁的 DSL（领域特定语言）来标记 workflow 节点，允许你：

  • 定义动态参数
  • 标记输出变量
  • 指定必需/可选参数
  • 自动处理媒体文件上传

docs.title: DSL 语法快速参考
docs.text:
这些 DSL 标记写在 **ComfyUI workflow 节点的 title 字段**中，用于将固定的 workflow 转换为可参数化的模板。

使用步骤： 1. 在 ComfyUI 编辑器中双击节点，修改 title 添加 DSL 标记（如 $prompt.text!） 2. 保存为 API 格式 JSON（菜单选择 "Save (API Format)"，不是普通 "Save"） 3. 通过 kit.execute("workflow.json", {"prompt": "value"}) 传参执行

⚠️ 注意：必须使用 API 格式的 workflow JSON，不是 UI 格式。

语法 描述 示例 效果 $param 基础参数（简写） $prompt 参数 prompt，映射到字段 prompt $param.field 指定字段映射 $prompt.text 参数 prompt，映射到字段 text $param! 必需参数 $prompt! 参数 prompt 是必需的，无默认值 $~param 媒体参数（上传） $~image 参数 image 需要文件上传 $~param! 必需媒体参数 $~image! 参数 image 是必需的且需要上传 $param.~field! 组合标记 $img.~image! 参数 img 映射到 image，必需且上传 $output.name 输出变量标记 $output.cover 标记输出变量名为 cover Text, $p1, $p2 多个参数 Size, $width!, $height! 在一个节点中定义多个参数

docs.title: 工作原理
docs.text:
DSL 通过在 workflow 节点的 _meta.title 字段添加标记来工作：

{
  "6": {
    "class_type": "CLIPTextEncode",
    "_meta": {
      "title": "$prompt.text!"
    },
    "inputs": {
      "text": "a beautiful landscape",
      "clip": ["4", 1]
    }
  }
}

当你执行这个 workflow：

result = await kit.execute("workflow.json", {
    "prompt": "a cute cat"
})

ComfyKit 会自动： 1. 解析 DSL 标记 2. 将 text 字段替换为 "a cute cat" 3. 执行修改后的 workflow

docs.title: 参数标记
docs.text:
• $param - 基础参数
  • $param.field - 带字段映射的参数
  • $param! - 必需参数
  • $~param - 媒体上传参数

详见参数详细示例。

docs.title: 输出标记
docs.text:
• $output.name - 标记输出变量

详见输出详细示例。

docs.title: 下一步
docs.text:
• 详细了解参数
  • 理解输出标记
  • 阅读最佳实践

docs.title: DSL 参数
docs.text: ComfyKit Workflow DSL 中参数标记的详细指南。

docs.title: 基础参数
docs.text:
最简单的形式 - 参数名与字段名匹配：

{
  "3": {
    "class_type": "KSampler",
    "_meta": {
      "title": "$seed"
    },
    "inputs": {
      "seed": 0
    }
  }
}

用法： 

result = await kit.execute("workflow.json", {"seed": 42})

docs.title: 字段映射
docs.text:
将参数映射到不同的字段名：

{
  "6": {
    "class_type": "CLIPTextEncode",
    "_meta": {
      "title": "$prompt.text"
    },
    "inputs": {
      "text": "default prompt"
    }
  }
}

用法： 

result = await kit.execute("workflow.json", {"prompt": "a cat"})
# "prompt" 参数映射到 "text" 字段

docs.title: 必需参数
docs.text:
使用 ! 标记必需参数：

{
  "5": {
    "class_type": "EmptyLatentImage",
    "_meta": {
      "title": "$width!, $height!"
    },
    "inputs": {
      "width": 512,
      "height": 512
    }
  }
}

用法： 

# 必须提供 width 和 height
result = await kit.execute("workflow.json", {
    "width": 1024,
    "height": 768
})

docs.title: 媒体上传参数
docs.text:
使用 ~ 标记需要文件上传的参数：

{
  "10": {
    "class_type": "LoadImage",
    "_meta": {
      "title": "$~input_image"
    },
    "inputs": {
      "image": "default.png"
    }
  }
}

用法： 

result = await kit.execute("workflow.json", {
    "input_image": "/path/to/image.jpg"  # 自动上传
})

docs.title: 组合标记
docs.text:
组合字段映射、上传和必需标记：

{
  "10": {
    "class_type": "LoadImage",
    "_meta": {
      "title": "$img.~image!"
    },
    "inputs": {
      "image": "default.png"
    }
  }
}

含义： - 参数名：img - 映射到字段：image - 需要上传：~ - 是必需的：!

docs.title: 多个参数
docs.text:
在一个节点中定义多个参数：

{
  "5": {
    "class_type": "EmptyLatentImage",
    "_meta": {
      "title": "Canvas Size, $width!, $height!, $batch_size"
    },
    "inputs": {
      "width": 512,
      "height": 512,
      "batch_size": 1
    }
  }
}

不带 $ 的文本会被忽略（仅用于显示）。

docs.title: 可选（有默认值）
docs.text:
"_meta": {
  "title": "$seed"
}
  • 如果未提供，使用 workflow 中的默认值
  • 省略时不会报错

docs.title: 必需（无默认值）
docs.text:
"_meta": {
  "title": "$seed!"
}
  • 必须提供
  • 省略时会报错

docs.title: 完整示例
docs.text:
{
  "4": {
    "class_type": "CheckpointLoaderSimple",
    "_meta": {
      "title": "$model.ckpt_name"
    },
    "inputs": {
      "ckpt_name": "sd_xl_base_1.0.safetensors"
    }
  },
  "5": {
    "class_type": "EmptyLatentImage",
    "_meta": {
      "title": "Size, $width!, $height!"
    },
    "inputs": {
      "width": 1024,
      "height": 1024
    }
  },
  "6": {
    "class_type": "CLIPTextEncode",
    "_meta": {
      "title": "$prompt.text!"
    },
    "inputs": {
      "text": "a beautiful landscape"
    }
  },
  "10": {
    "class_type": "LoadImage",
    "_meta": {
      "title": "$~init_image"
    },
    "inputs": {
      "image": "default.png"
    }
  }
}

用法： 

result = await kit.execute("workflow.json", {
    "prompt": "a cute cat",           # 必需
    "width": 1024,                     # 必需
    "height": 768,                     # 必需
    "model": "dreamshaper_8.safetensors",  # 可选
    "init_image": "/path/to/init.jpg"  # 可选，自动上传
})

docs.title: 下一步
docs.text:
• 了解输出
  • 阅读最佳实践

docs.title: 执行本地 Workflow
docs.text:
最基本的用法是执行本地 workflow 文件：

from comfykit import ComfyKit

# Connect to local ComfyUI (default: http://127.0.0.1:8188)
kit = ComfyKit()

# 执行本地 workflow 文件
result = await kit.execute("workflow.json", {
    "prompt": "a cat",
    "seed": 42,
    "steps": 20
})

docs.title: 执行远程 Workflow URL
docs.text:
ComfyKit 可以自动下载并执行来自 URL 的 workflow：

# 自动下载并执行
result = await kit.execute(
    "https://example.com/workflow.json",
    {"prompt": "a cat"}
)

docs.title: 从字典执行 Workflow
docs.text:
你也可以将 workflow 作为 Python 字典传递：

workflow_dict = {
    "nodes": [...],
    "edges": [...]
}

result = await kit.execute_json(workflow_dict, {
    "prompt": "a cat"
})

docs.title: 自定义 ComfyUI 服务器
docs.text:
连接到远程 ComfyUI 服务器：

kit = ComfyKit(
    comfyui_url="http://my-server:8188",
    api_key="your-api-key"  # 如果需要认证
)

docs.title: 参数
docs.text:
Workflows 可以接受在 workflow DSL 中定义的参数。详见 Workflow DSL。

result = await kit.execute("workflow.json", {
    "prompt": "a beautiful landscape",
    "width": 1024,
    "height": 768,
    "seed": 42,
    "steps": 30
})

docs.title: 错误处理
docs.text:
始终检查执行状态：

result = await kit.execute("workflow.json", params)

if result.status == "completed":
    print("成功！")
    print(f"图片: {result.images}")
else:
    print(f"失败: {result.msg}")

docs.title: Async/Await
docs.text:
ComfyKit 的所有操作都使用 async/await：

import asyncio
from comfykit import ComfyKit

async def main():
    kit = ComfyKit()
    result = await kit.execute("workflow.json", {"prompt": "a cat"})
    print(result.images)

# 运行异步函数
asyncio.run(main())

docs.title: 下一步
docs.text:
• 了解本地 ComfyUI 设置
  • 探索 RunningHub 云端 执行
  • 理解结果处理

docs.title: RunningHub 云端执行
docs.text: 使用 RunningHub 云平台执行 workflow，无需本地 GPU 或 ComfyUI 安装。

docs.title: 获取 API Key
docs.text:
1. 访问 RunningHub
  2. 注册免费账号
  3. 从控制台获取 API key

docs.title: 基础用法
docs.text:
from comfykit import ComfyKit

# 使用 RunningHub API key 初始化
kit = ComfyKit(
    runninghub_api_key="rh-key-xxx"
)

# 使用 workflow ID 执行
result = await kit.execute("12345", {
    "prompt": "a beautiful landscape"
})

docs.title: 配置选项
docs.text:
kit = ComfyKit(
    # RunningHub API URL（可选）
    runninghub_url="https://www.runninghub.ai",  # 默认值

    # API Key（必需）
    runninghub_api_key="rh-key-xxx",

    # 超时时间（秒）（可选）
    runninghub_timeout=300,  # 默认: 5 分钟

    # 重试次数（可选）
    runninghub_retry_count=3  # 默认: 3 次重试
)

docs.title: 环境变量
docs.text:
export RUNNINGHUB_BASE_URL="https://www.runninghub.ai"
export RUNNINGHUB_API_KEY="rh-key-xxx"
export RUNNINGHUB_TIMEOUT="300"
export RUNNINGHUB_RETRY_COUNT="3"

docs.title: 完整示例
docs.text:
import asyncio
from comfykit import ComfyKit

async def main():
    # 使用 RunningHub 初始化
    kit = ComfyKit(
        runninghub_api_key="rh-key-xxx"
    )

    # 执行 workflow
    result = await kit.execute("12345", {
        "prompt": "a cute cat playing with yarn",
        "width": 1024,
        "height": 768,
        "steps": 30
    })

    if result.status == "completed":
        print(f"✅ 成功！耗时: {result.duration:.2f}秒")
        print(f"🖼️  图片: {result.images}")
    else:
        print(f"❌ 失败: {result.msg}")

asyncio.run(main())

docs.title: Workflow ID
docs.text:
RunningHub workflow 通过数字 ID 标识。你可以在以下位置找到 workflow ID：

  • RunningHub workflow 画廊
  • 你的个人 workflow 列表
  • 分享的 workflow 链接

docs.title: 优势
docs.text:
• ☁️ 无需 GPU：在云基础设施上运行
  • 🚀 快速：优化的 GPU 实例
  • 📦 预配置：所有模型和依赖已就绪
  • 💰 成本效益：按使用量付费

docs.title: 下一步
docs.text:
• 了解结果处理
  • 探索完整示例

docs.title: 本地 ComfyUI
docs.text: 本指南介绍如何使用 ComfyKit 连接本地 ComfyUI。

docs.title: 前置条件
docs.text:
1. 已安装 ComfyUI
  2. 启动 ComfyUI 服务器（默认端口 8188）

docs.title: 启动 ComfyUI
docs.text:
cd /path/to/ComfyUI
python main.py

默认情况下，ComfyUI 运行在 http://127.0.0.1:8188。

docs.title: 基础配置
docs.text:
ComfyKit 默认自动连接本地 ComfyUI：

from comfykit import ComfyKit

# 使用默认 URL http://127.0.0.1:8188
kit = ComfyKit()

docs.title: 自定义配置
docs.text:
如果你的 ComfyUI 运行在不同的端口或主机：

kit = ComfyKit(
    comfyui_url="http://localhost:8189"
)

docs.title: 执行器类型
docs.text: ComfyKit 支持两种执行器类型：

docs.title: HTTP 执行器（推荐）
docs.text:
kit = ComfyKit(
    executor_type="http"  # 默认
)

优点： - 更稳定 - 更好的错误处理 - 生产环境推荐

docs.title: WebSocket 执行器
docs.text:
kit = ComfyKit(
    executor_type="websocket"
)

优点： - 实时进度更新 - 长时间运行的 workflow 延迟更低

docs.title: 认证
docs.text:
如果你的 ComfyUI 服务器需要认证：

kit = ComfyKit(
    comfyui_url="http://my-server:8188",
    api_key="your-api-key",
    cookies="session=abc123"
)

docs.title: 环境变量
docs.text:
你也可以通过环境变量配置：

export COMFYUI_BASE_URL="http://127.0.0.1:8188"
export COMFYUI_EXECUTOR_TYPE="http"
export COMFYUI_API_KEY="your-api-key"
export COMFYUI_COOKIES="session=abc123"

然后无参数初始化：

kit = ComfyKit()  # 使用环境变量

docs.title: 完整示例
docs.text:
import asyncio
from comfykit import ComfyKit

async def main():
    # 连接本地 ComfyUI
    kit = ComfyKit(
        comfyui_url="http://127.0.0.1:8188",
        executor_type="http"
    )

    # 执行 workflow
    result = await kit.execute(
        "workflow.json",
        params={
            "prompt": "a cute cat playing with yarn",
            "width": 1024,
            "height": 768
        }
    )

    # 检查结果
    if result.status == "completed":
        print(f"✅ 成功！耗时: {result.duration:.2f}秒")
        print(f"🖼️  图片: {result.images}")

        # 如需要可以下载图片
        for img_url in result.images:
            print(f"图片 URL: {img_url}")
    else:
        print(f"❌ 失败: {result.msg}")

asyncio.run(main())

docs.title: 连接被拒绝
docs.text:
如果遇到连接被拒绝错误：

  1. 确保 ComfyUI 正在运行
  2. 检查端口号（默认是 8188）
  3. 验证 URL 是否正确

docs.title: 超时错误
docs.text:
对于长时间运行的 workflow，可能需要增加超时时间：

import httpx

kit = ComfyKit(
    comfyui_url="http://127.0.0.1:8188",
)
# 注意：超时配置即将推出

docs.title: 下一步
docs.text:
• 了解 RunningHub 云端 无需 GPU 执行
  • 理解结果处理

docs.title: 结果处理
docs.text: 理解和处理 ComfyKit 的执行结果。

docs.title: ExecuteResult 对象
docs.text:
当你执行 workflow 时，ComfyKit 返回一个 ExecuteResult 对象：

result = await kit.execute("workflow.json", {"prompt": "a cat"})

docs.title: 状态
docs.text:
# 检查执行状态
if result.status == "completed":
    print("成功！")
elif result.status == "failed":
    print(f"失败: {result.msg}")

docs.title: 耗时
docs.text:
# 执行时间（秒）
print(f"执行耗时 {result.duration:.2f} 秒")

docs.title: Prompt ID
docs.text:
# 唯一执行标识符
print(f"执行 ID: {result.prompt_id}")

docs.title: 所有媒体文件
docs.text:
# 所有图片 URL 列表
print(result.images)  # ['http://...', 'http://...']

# 所有视频 URL 列表
print(result.videos)  # ['http://...']

# 所有音频 URL 列表
print(result.audios)  # ['http://...']

# 所有文本输出列表
print(result.texts)  # ['generated text...']

docs.title: 按变量名分组
docs.text:
如果你的 workflow 使用了 $output.name 标记，可以通过变量名访问输出：

# 通过名称获取特定输出
cover_image = result.images_by_var["cover"][0]
thumbnail = result.images_by_var["thumbnail"][0]

# 通过名称获取视频
final_video = result.videos_by_var["final"][0]

docs.title: 下载图片
docs.text:
import httpx
from pathlib import Path

async def download_image(url: str, save_path: Path):
    async with httpx.AsyncClient() as client:
        response = await client.get(url)
        save_path.write_bytes(response.content)

# 下载所有图片
for i, img_url in enumerate(result.images):
    await download_image(img_url, Path(f"output_{i}.png"))

docs.title: 使用 PIL
docs.text:
from PIL import Image
import httpx
from io import BytesIO

async def load_pil_image(url: str) -> Image.Image:
    async with httpx.AsyncClient() as client:
        response = await client.get(url)
        return Image.open(BytesIO(response.content))

# 加载和处理
pil_image = await load_pil_image(result.images[0])
pil_image.show()

# 进一步处理
resized = pil_image.resize((512, 512))
resized.save("output.png")

docs.title: 完整示例
docs.text:
import asyncio
from comfykit import ComfyKit
from pathlib import Path
import httpx

async def main():
    kit = ComfyKit()

    # 执行 workflow
    result = await kit.execute("workflow.json", {
        "prompt": "a beautiful sunset"
    })

    # 检查状态
    if result.status != "completed":
        print(f"失败: {result.msg}")
        return

    print(f"✅ 成功！耗时 {result.duration:.2f}秒")
    print(f"生成了 {len(result.images)} 张图片")

    # 通过变量名访问
    if "cover" in result.images_by_var:
        cover_url = result.images_by_var["cover"][0]
        print(f"封面图片: {cover_url}")

    # 下载所有图片
    output_dir = Path("outputs")
    output_dir.mkdir(exist_ok=True)

    async with httpx.AsyncClient() as client:
        for i, img_url in enumerate(result.images):
            response = await client.get(img_url)
            output_path = output_dir / f"image_{i}.png"
            output_path.write_bytes(response.content)
            print(f"已保存: {output_path}")

asyncio.run(main())
